info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 8 at 9:06AM EDT until April 9 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia...
Meherrin River At Lawrenceville affecting Greensville and Brunswick Counties.
For the Chowan Basin...including Lawrenceville...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Meherrin River at Lawrenceville.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Pasture land north of the river, downstream of the gage, begins to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 11.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 17.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on 03/22/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON
